subject: AI & Agents
title: RAG vs Fine-Tuning: Choosing the Right Approach
description: A micro-lesson that makes RAG vs Fine-Tuning: Choosing the Right Approach usable.

hook.text: Your product needs domain-specific answers. Do you fine-tune a model or plug in a knowledge base?

buildup.text: RAG retrieves documents at query time. Fine-tuning bakes knowledge into model weights.

discovery.text: RAG: fresh data, no retraining, transparent sources. Fine-tuning: faster inference, custom style.

twist.text: RAG + fine-tuning together often beats either alone. Fine-tune for style, RAG for facts.

climax.text: Start with RAG (cheaper, faster). Add fine-tuning only if quality gaps remain.

punchline.text: Retrieve for facts. Fine-tune for flavor.

quiz.question: When should you start with RAG over fine-tuning?
options: When you need fresh data and transparent sources without retraining
